name: Tony Joe White
description: '''Tony Joe White''' (July 23, 1943 â€“ October 24, 2018), nicknamed the '''Swamp Fox''', was an American singer-songwriter and guitarist, best known for his 1969 [[hit record|hit]] "[[Polk Salad Annie]]" and for "[[Rainy Night in Georgia]]", which he wrote but which was first made popular by [[Brook Benton]] in 1970. He also wrote "[[Steamy Windows]]" and "Undercover Agent for the Blues", both hits for [[Tina Turner]] in 1989; those two songs came by way of Turner's producer at the time, [[Mark Knopfler]], who was a friend of White. "Polk Salad Annie" was also recorded by [[Joe Dassin]], [[Elvis Presley]], [[Joe Bonamassa]] and [[Tom Jones (singer)|Tom Jones]].
